In vain his anxious eye some Cot explores,</br>As o'er the dreary heath his footsteps wind;</br>Around his head the ruthless tempest pours,</br>And fear and anguish press him close behind.
And now a blaze of lightning flashing bright,</br>Aghast — he views the awful Gibbet near;</br>And slowly rising from the neighb'ring height,</br>The fancied forms of shadowy Ghosts appear.
In airy circles while around they flit,</br>And with shrill shrieks lament their fatal doom;</br>Lo!  still Attention on yon hillock sit,</br>An hollow voice thus issuing from the tomb!
"Ye thoughtless Many, who from earliest youth</br>The wayward paths of vice and folly tread,</br>Hear from the Grave the sacred voice of Truth,</br>Nor scorn instruction from the Unhappy Dead."
This barren spot, where legal victims lie,</br>With speed you pass, as groundless fears impel;</br>Yet here Reflection with the thoughtful eye,</br>And melancholy Musing love to dwell.
Here with swoln heart the pensive mourner views</br>Th' uncoffin'd victims in their cells beneath;</br>Each varied scene while memory pursues</br>From life's fair morning to the tree of death.
Haply on these has some fond parent smil'd,</br>And as he view'd with joy the blessing giv'n,</br>Has pray'd th' Eternal, "O protect my child,</br>And grant him virtue, happiness, and Heaven!"

For these, with sleepless eye and anxious breast,</br>Has some fond mother nightly vigils kept;</br>And as she lull'd her infant charge to rest,</br>Has smil'd with transport, and with transport wept!
The harmless prattle of their lisping tongues</br>With ears enraptur'd have their parents heard:</br>Dissolv'd, in tenderness have o'er them hung,</br>And fancied plans of future fame uprear'd.
Delusive fabric!  on a base how frail</br>Each flat'ring hope of human bliss is built!</br>Soon the young blossoms feel the noxious gale,</br>By which example taints the soul with guilt.</br>
